main event: On 6 October 1957 in Presque Isle, Me., a silver object was observed at 2321Z, flying in a straight line for 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The object had the appearance of 15 degrees or 60 dots above the horizon.
It was not round-shaped, but rather shaped like an airplane with wings.
The silver object disappeared from sight little above the horizon after following a straight course.
It was observed using binoculars with high thin overcast and some cirrus clouds present.
There was speculation about the object being an earth satellite or in relation to a weather balloon.
sighted object: a silver object flying in a straight line
witnesses: GODDR 73TH FIS PIAPD 11C, RJEDER/CO:DR ADO EWT APF COLO SPRINGS COLO, RJEDER/CO:DR ATTS WRIGHT-PATTERSON: APF OHIO
